title: ion-button
body: Buttons provide a clickable element, which can be used in forms, or anywhere that needs simple, standard button functionality. They may display text, icons, or both. Buttons can be styled with several attributes to look a specific way.
This attribute lets you specify how wide the button should be. By default, buttons are inline blocks, but setting this attribute will change the button to a full-width block element.
Full-width button with square corners and no border on the left or right.

This attributes determines the background and border color of the button. By default, buttons have a solid background unless the button is inside of a toolbar, in which case it has a transparent background.
Button with a transparent background that resembles a flat button.
Button with a transparent background and a visible border.
Button with a filled background. Useful for buttons in a toolbar.
This attribute specifies the size of the button. Setting this attribute will change the height and padding of a button.
Button with less height and padding. Default for buttons in an item.
Button with the default height and padding. Useful for buttons in an item.
Button with more height and padding.

props.name: color
props.docs: The color to use from your application's color palette. Default options are: "primary", "secondary", "tertiary", "success", "warning", "danger", "light", "medium", and "dark". For more information on colors, see theming.

props.name: disabled
props.docs: If true, the user cannot interact with the button.

props.name: download
props.docs: This attribute instructs browsers to download a URL instead of navigating to it, so the user will be prompted to save it as a local file. If the attribute has a value, it is used as the pre-filled file name in the Save prompt (the user can still change the file name if they want).

props.name: expand
props.docs: Set to "block" for a full-width button or to "full" for a full-width button without left and right borders.

props.name: fill
props.docs: Set to "clear" for a transparent button, to "outline" for a transparent button with a border, or to "solid". The default style is "solid" except inside of a toolbar, where the default is "clear".

props.name: href
props.docs: Contains a URL or a URL fragment that the hyperlink points to. If this property is set, an anchor tag will be rendered.

props.name: mode
props.docs: The mode determines which platform styles to use.

props.name: rel
props.docs: Specifies the relationship of the target object to the link object. The value is a space-separated list of link types.

props.name: routerDirection
props.docs: When using a router, it specifies the transition direction when navigating to another page using href.

props.name: strong
props.docs: If true, activates a button with a heavier font weight.

props.name: target
props.docs: Specifies where to display the linked URL. Only applies when an href is provided. Special keywords: "_blank", "_self", "_parent", "_top".

docs: Buttons provide a clickable element, which can be used in forms, or anywhere that needs simple, standard button functionality. They may display text, icons, or both. Buttons can be styled with several attributes to look a specific way.

docsTags.text: {"ios" | "md"} mode - The mode determines which platform styles to use.
docsTags.name: virtualProp

docsTags.text: - Content is placed between the named slots if provided without a slot.
docsTags.name: slot

docsTags.text: icon-only - Should be used on an icon in a button that has no text.
docsTags.name: slot

docsTags.text: start - Content is placed to the left of the button text in LTR, and to the right in RTL.
docsTags.name: slot

docsTags.text: end - Content is placed to the right of the button text in LTR, and to the left in RTL.
docsTags.name: slot

events.docs: Emitted when the button loses focus.
Emitted when the button has focus.

styles.name: --background
styles.docs: Background of the button

styles.name: --background-activated
styles.docs: Background of the button when pressed. Note: setting this will interfere with the Material Design ripple.

styles.name: --background-activated-opacity
styles.docs: Opacity of the button when pressed

styles.name: --background-focused
styles.docs: Background of the button when focused with the tab key

styles.name: --background-focused-opacity
styles.docs: Opacity of the button when focused with the tab key

styles.name: --background-hover
styles.docs: Background of the button on hover

styles.name: --background-hover-opacity
styles.docs: Opacity of the background on hover

styles.name: --border-color
styles.docs: Border color of the button

styles.name: --border-radius
styles.docs: Border radius of the button

styles.name: --border-style
styles.docs: Border style of the button

styles.name: --border-width
styles.docs: Border width of the button

styles.name: --box-shadow
styles.docs: Box shadow of the button

styles.name: --color
styles.docs: Text color of the button

styles.name: --color-activated
styles.docs: Text color of the button when pressed

styles.name: --color-focused
styles.docs: Text color of the button when focused with the tab key

styles.name: --color-hover
styles.docs: Text color of the button when hover

styles.name: --opacity
styles.docs: Opacity of the button

styles.name: --padding-bottom
styles.docs: Bottom padding of the button

styles.name: --padding-end
styles.docs: Right padding if direction is left-to-right, and left padding if direction is right-to-left of the button

styles.name: --padding-start
styles.docs: Left padding if direction is left-to-right, and right padding if direction is right-to-left of the button

styles.name: --padding-top
styles.docs: Top padding of the button

styles.name: --ripple-color
styles.docs: Color of the button ripple effect

styles.name: --transition
styles.docs: Transition of the button

slots.docs: Content is placed between the named slots if provided without a slot.

slots.name: end
slots.docs: Content is placed to the right of the button text in LTR, and to the left in RTL.

slots.name: icon-only
slots.docs: Should be used on an icon in a button that has no text.

slots.name: start
slots.docs: Content is placed to the left of the button text in LTR, and to the right in RTL.
